lines.text: There's a lot of nobility in this room. Must be the paneling.
lines.character: Superior Court Judge Steven R. Hardin

lines.text: Someone has taken justice and hidden it in the law.
The law. Nothing is right or wrong! It's either the law or its not the law. Well, we got a problem here, because it's not working anymore. It turns out that right and wrong count.
lines.character: Superior Court Judge Steven R. Hardin

lines.text: It's always been a game, only now the bad guys have a stronger team, got a better draft.
You know I took a lot of notes in your class and I can never remember you saying anything quite like that.
lines.character: Superior Court Judge Steven R. Hardin

lines.text: You should have taken fewer notes and listened more.
How can someone torture a child? How do you erase that sound from your head? Those two are creatures, they're not human beings.
If you don't eat, you could die. You could die here. I don't want you to die here. If you die here, I have to fill out all kinds of paperwork. And you know how I hate to do paperwork.
